intro: Machaeranthera varians, commonly known as the variable blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in prairie and open woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Machaeranthera varians is a perennial herb that blooms in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
